questions.question: What is a hub?
questions.explanation: Hub: repeats to all ports. Layer: physical (1). Collision: shared medium. Speed: half-duplex. Ports: multiple. Modern: rarely used. Importance: legacy technology.

questions.question: What is a switch?
questions.explanation: Switch: forwards to specific ports. Layer: data link (2). Learning: MAC address table. Speed: full-duplex. Collision: eliminated. Importance: network standard.

questions.question: What is a router?
questions.explanation: Router: forwards between networks. Layer: network (3). Protocol: IP-based. Ports: physical or logical. Purpose: route packets. Importance: network essential.

questions.question: What is a modem?
questions.explanation: Modem: converts signal types. Purpose: internet connectivity. Types: cable, fiber, DSL. Connection: ISP link. Home: essential device. Importance: internet access.

questions.question: What is a repeater?
questions.explanation: Repeater: boosts signal. Layer: physical (1). Limitation: no intelligence. Purpose: extend range. Wireless: WiFi extender. Importance: range extension.

questions.question: What is a wireless access point (AP)?
questions.explanation: AP: creates wireless network. Standard: 802.11x. Coverage: limited range. SSID: network name. Security: encryption. Importance: wireless fundamental.

questions.question: What is a network interface card (NIC)?
questions.explanation: NIC: hardware connectivity. Types: Ethernet, wireless. MAC address: burned on NIC. Driver: software control. Speed: varies by type. Importance: network connection.

questions.question: What is a gateway?
questions.explanation: Gateway: connects networks. Protocol: may translate. Function: forwards between networks. IP: configured address. Example: router. Importance: network connection.

questions.question: What is a bridge?
questions.explanation: Bridge: connects LANs. Layer: data link (2). Learning: MAC addresses. Function: filters traffic. Modern: switches replaced. Importance: legacy technology.

questions.question: What is a firewall?
questions.explanation: Firewall: filters traffic. Location: network edge. Rules: allow/deny policies. Types: hardware, software. Purpose: protection. Importance: security essential.
